comments.body: I think what we should do here is track pings that aren't successfully sent, and then send them the next time the tool is started, asynchronously. However, we'd have to give each ping a globally unique ID so that we could de-dupe on the server in the cases where we think it wasn't sent but it actually was.

We don't have control of the backend - it's just standard google analytics. But I have seen tools that do something similar to what you're describing. Any un-sent commands are buffered to a file for sending during the next session.

Analytics is generally a best effort thing however; if we lose some (small) portion of our pings, that's ok. It's more a problem when we lose some type preferentially, and end up skewing the data.
